data.what_is:
theMarketer is an all-in-one email and loyalty marketing platform, designed to boost business growth and forge authentic customer relationships. 

Create 100% personalized newsletters, build loyalty programs, set up automated flows, send SMS & push notifications, grow your contact list with pop-ups, rely on RFM analysis, collect feedback & reviews, and leverage referrals to turn customer interactions into meaningful relationships, enhance brand loyalty as well as customer lifetime value.
data.product_description: Email marketing platform with loyalty program included

pricing_plans.plan_description: Ideal for start-ups, individuals, and those who want to give the platform a try.
Perfect for emerging online shops looking to grow their business
Suitable for non-e-commerce businesses that aim to improve their relationship with their clients.
Perfect for established online shops seeking to optimize their processes.

initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about theMarketer?
theMarketer provides an complete solution where we can link our website and all the product will be linked and which can be used for sending email campaigns and promotional activity. Also provides an provision for sending push notification. Automation is the game changer where you can set what happens when emails are not opened and what happens when email is opened but not clicked.

What do you dislike about theMarketer?
New user gets confused when sending an email campaign as it says to save as draft.

What problems is theMarketer solving and how is that benefiting you?
Email marketing is used for sending email campaigns to user with automated emails when linked to our website. Just select an products / category and set it live.

initial_reviews.review_title: Powerful features at an acceptable price
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about theMarketer?
It offers a ton of features, like you find in Klaviyo or other big platforms, but at a way better price. I like it how I can see all the details for my clients, what they did, what they bought, they automatically detect the idela product, category, super nice.

What do you dislike about theMarketer?
Sometimes it's hard for me to find a specific screen, I forget where it is or I can't find in the navigation. I think they could do better at UX.

What problems is theMarketer solving and how is that benefiting you?
I can get more out of my email marketing campaigns, I can generate more money for my shop with their campaigns and automations.
